page.title: 03EARDISLEY HOUSING & TRAFFIC
page.content: Many of the{houses}in Eardisley are black and white .By the pump is a 14th.century house called Cruck house because the{cruck beams}can be seen. Another 14th. century building is Upper House Farm,it has a Monk's room, as it may have been built as a religious foundation.There are a few {modern}houses,24{Council houses}and 18 {old peoples bungalows}. Recently two long barns have been converted into rows of black and white terraced houses. We did a{traffic survey}of the road outside school.We sat outside for 1hr. in the morning and 1hr.in the afternoon.We found there was more traffic in the afternoon than in the morning.Over 65% of the traffic on both occasions were cars.Most of the other vehicles were local lorries or vans or from Wales and the Midlands.
